item.title: R package CTRE: thresholding bursty time series
item.description: The new R package CTRE is now available on CRAN. “CTRE” stands for “Continuous Time Random Exceedances”, which is a model for extreme values of bursty time series. The theory is desribed in another paper (html|pdf). library(CTRE) flares_ctre <- ctre(flares) plot(flares_ctre, log = "y", main = "Solar Flares") The above time series are measurements of solar flare magnitudes by NASA1. Which observations are considered extreme is defined by a variable threshold \(u\) (dashed line, \(< 5\%\) of observations).
